context: Can I twist the stick to control yaw in a helicopter  or use it as rudder in a plane?
response: The stick's handle DOES rotate left and right, and controls an airplane's rudder.  It's my understanding that it also controls the speed of the tail rotor in a helicopter, so yes, it would control yaw in a whirlybird also.  (The stick itself acts as the 'collective', controlling forward / backward 'tilt' and left / right banking.)

context: Do you have to buy the discs to install in order to play online? Or do you just buy the subscription and play?
response: You don't have to buy the discs, you can download it online. You do have to pay an initial cost, but when you do, it comes with 30 days play time included. Afyerwards you just pay the sub.

response: Sure can. My Windows 8.1 machine automatically detected the appropriate drivers and installed them for me.

context: Can you record text macros on the 'G" keys?
response: Yes you can; the macro software available from the Corsair website - http://www.corsair.com/en-us/support/downloads - includes a .pdf manual which shows how to program and edit macros, both on the hardware and software sides.

context: I have a PS3 arcade stick which is getting detected in Win 8.1 64 bit, but the buttons aren't working due to nodrivers. Will this adapter work for me?
response: I use that Adapter mainly for PS2 controllers in Windows 7.  It might help you, but I would first try Motion in Joy and/or SCP DS3

context: Does anyone else feel like the left driver is noticeably louder than the right?
